Reviews.Content: Hotel Azzi, Hotel Anna, or 1 of 6? Used Venere as their price was less than Hotel quoted. When we arrived the Triple room that had been confirmed by the Hotel was not available so they crammed a Cot into a Double room. This room was small and also had a bathroom whereby the shower spayed the entire bathroom including the toilet paper! We were moved to a larger room at the front of the hotel the next day, a proper triple and other than the increased street noise where well satisfied with it. It was a long hike up the stairs and the room was in a different Hotel sharing the same property. In fact there were about 6 different hotels in the same building! The location was terrific but use Rick Steve's recommendations for resturants; They're not all good nearby!
Reviews.Author: GaryReg

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location! We loved this hotel. We came by train to Firenze and it was just a short walk from the main train station. We were struck by surprize when we we were handed the keys to our room. I think we were lucky, as we ended up in a big suite with a big batroom where we even had our own jacuzzi...and we paid only 65鈧?with breakfast. (Booked through venere.com). Lovely tiled bathroom, lovely decorated room with wooden, antique furniture and nice beds. Breakfast was decent, but simple, just what we needed before strolling south to all the marvels of Firenze. The hotels is situated in a nice, quiet street within easy walking distance of all sights. Close to Academia (Michelangelo's David), a 10-minute walk from the Cathedral and maybe 15 minutes from Uffizi. The hotel is an old convent with a nice a terrace and nice lounge-breakfast area. Helpful, polite and efficient staff. I would definitely recommend hotel Azzi!!
Reviews.Author: MaxOslo

Reviews.Content: Not so great if you're looking for a clean, cozy place I agree this place has its own ambience and character, but it just didn't go with me. The ambience included chipped bathroom tiles, questionable sheets, and the squeaky dusty floor. And the funny smell also. All in all, it felt very depressing and weary just to be in the room. If you can cope with that to enjoy a chat with the kind owner, look at the arty objects decorating the lobby, and have a wonderful breakfast in that spacious breakfast room, then it's OK. But I don't believe ambience should come at the expense of cleanliness and coziness. Next time I visit, I shall definitely stay at another place.
Reviews.Author: acc-tou

Reviews.Content: Easy, comfortable hotel Although a 2 star hotel, my girlfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Azzi. The room was big, if not exactly refined. Lots of second hand furniture, but we didn't really mind. The shower was very good, and the bathroom itself looked as if it was newly renovated. Location was great, lots of solid restaurants nearby, as well as the train station and the Duomo. All in all, enjoyed the stay. For the price, hard to top.
Reviews.Author: eroq

Reviews.Content: Depends what your looking for!! We had a suite but I can confer with some of the other reviews in regards to the small rooms because I peeked into some of them. For the price it was worth it.  The goodGreat lobby to hang out in. Great location (close enough to sites and train but not in the heart with a million tourists), Great price. The size of the room was great. Staff was kind.The badThe room (obvious sewer issues) smelled. Bathroom is very small. The breakfast, expecially coffee, was only mediocre. I may or may not stay again depending on the type of trip I am taking. I was there for five days and at times I just wanted to chill in the room. Yet, due to the smell, lack of any English speaking channels, and the not so comfortable bed and couch, I did little chilling. If you know you will be out anduse the room for showering and sleeping it'll work.Enjoy!!
Reviews.Author: monica1093

Reviews.Content: Wonderful We stayed at the Azzi on our honeymoon and absoluley LOVED it. The staff were friendly, the hotel had a wonderfully relaxed vibe and the location couldn't have been better. 5 minutes walk from the train station though you would never know. Would highly recommend to anyone going to Florence.
Reviews.Author: ManchesterDaisy

Reviews.Content: Clostrophobia to the extreme.. Clostrophobia to the extreme - Narrow hallways, no elevator, and the room was like grandma's non-remodeled home from 100 years ago. Terrible paint, bed, furnishings, and ambience. I'd rather stay at a Motel 6 in the US than this dump. Oh, if you need crack or a hooker, they're right on the street that this hotel is located on.
Reviews.Author: tripextreme

Reviews.Content: Sweet room, lovely jazz We got this hotel last minute from the lonely planet. Close to the station, thank god cause it was bucketing down. Arrived to a warm lobby, with jazz playing and I loved it instantly. Carlos was really helpful! Arranging some other accom for us and recommending places to go. The other lady at recpetion was not so good, just avoided her. Breakfast was a welcome surprise and tea and coffee all day was really great. The room was cute with a big antique furniture and little sitting room. Some smell from toilet occasionally, but you get that everywhere in Italy!Loved it!
Reviews.Author: RJ_NZ

Reviews.Content: Kindness to celiacs! My son and I stayed at the Azzi for 2 nights in July. Our room was basic (open shower) but spotlessly clean, quiet, air-conditioned, smoke-free. It is part of a building containing several hostels and we were put in a 3-star affiliate in the same building. We ate our breakfasts downstairs, where there is also a charming little bar, and the lobby with a big comfortable couch also has bookshelves crammed with interesting titles.No phones in the rooms, nothing fancy for those who are looking for luxury or a place to loll by a window with a view (a highly recommended activity in general, just not what we were after on this trip!), but we were either out and about in Florence or asleep, so posh would have been wasted on us.The location is close to the train station, so, convenient if not scenic, but we enjoyed our strolls through the central market to the historic center.What made Azzi stand out is that the night manager, Gianni, went out of his way to make sure we could get a good gluten-free dinner, even phoning ahead to the recommended restaurant w/o telling us to make sure we were taken care of! In the mornings, Giulietta, the day manager, not only saw to it that our parbaked gluten-free breads (available in every pharmacy we visited in Italy!) were cooked for the morning's breakfast by the helpful Fatima, but also had one cooked for us to take on the road. The location is close to the train station, so, convenient if not scenic, but we were a lovely stroll through the central market to the historic center. When we left, Giulietta was very concerned that we have gluten-free options at our next stays, and gave me stern instructions on how to secure that result. She and Gianni were the most kind hosts of our several stays in Italy, even though this was the lowest priced place we stayed.
Reviews.Author: Lily76

Reviews.Content: Possesses that much misused term 鈥?character.       Hotel Azzi - spacious room
Reviews.Author: coverpoint

Reviews.Content: Great Experience We Stayed at the Hotel Azzi for 10 days in mid March. We stayed in the Marine section. While at first I was pleased with the hotel 's location and cleaneness, I began to feel like family to the friendly staff who we saw daily. Giulietta, Carlo, Giovanni, Emma, and others whos name I cannot recall. They were all professional, friendy and helpful.This is really a class Hotel. By the time I left, I felt like family, ecspecially to Giulietta who always went up and beyond the call of her job to make us feel welcome. Also, great value for the money, large rooms by Europe's standards. Ernesto M
Reviews.Author: Renatosocal

Reviews.Content: Horrible experience This was one of the most horrible and embarassing travel experiences of my life. Of course the hotel itself was kind of smelly but that is normal for a 2 star in Italy. What was really shocking was my experience with the staff. I had been in contact with Giulietta several times prior to arrival and every contact we had was pleasant so I had no reason to suspect. But the first morning I arrived downstairs to meet Giulietta for the 1st time who, despite all of our pleasant contact, barked at me that we had to pack our things and change rooms immediately. When I asked why, she told me she had a large group of clients she had to accomodate. I was under the impression that WE were ALSO clients and politely explained that since she decided to tell us at the last minute at 8am in the morning just before we had to leave for a very important meeting, it was not possible. She started arguing with me and insisting we had to move. I apologized and told her no, but that I would do my best to be back by 12pm. She demanded my phone number so she could call if we were late. Our meeting ran late and I called her (out of courtesy) to explain I could not be there on time. What happened next was unbelievable. She began screaming in my ear -carrying on and cursing me for not being able to come back. She said she would go and take our things herself and I threatened to call the police. Then she threatened to call the police if I didn't come back. I was at a professional meeting and some of my nearby colleagues could hear her yelling through the phone it was so bad. Never EVER in my life has anyone EVER spoken to me in such a way - let alone an associate at a hotel I was staying at!!! I finally hung up because I could not get a word in through her ranting and raving. I showed up after my meeting and she immediately apologized. But the damage had been done. We kindly said we'd prefer not to stay there another night and left. I have stayed in many hotels in many cities but have NEVER experienced such a horror. Please do yourself a favor and just avoid Giulietta and Hotel Azzi althogether.
Reviews.Author: CestLaVieInParis

Reviews.Content: Couldn't have chosen better!! We choose Hotel Azzi as it was near to the station, where we had arrived from Pisa via coach, and close to all the *touristy bits*, and we weren't disappointed. The VFM was incredible! The staff were exemplory, the room was clean and tidy and the shower was HOT!! The breakfast was very good, plenty of it and included in the price (100 euros for 2 nights for 2 persons). I believe that the price excludes breakfast in high season. You are within easy walking distance of all that you might want to see. We fell in love with this hotel, and would certainly recommend it to our friends (as we have!). Don't forget to check out their own red wine; 3 euros a bottle and excellent.
Reviews.Author: HolidayloverIpswich

Reviews.Content: Incredible Experience       Bianca
Reviews.Author: January6

Reviews.Content: Decent room- good location       Bianca
Reviews.Author: KCPL

Reviews.Content: Bright, cheerful and good value Compared to other hotels in this price range the rooms are large, recently painted in bright colours, and large windows that don鈥檛 open out onto a street. Okay, they open out onto a derelict house, but with no traffic below it is bearable in noisy Florence. The bathrooms are small, but again recently renovated and everything worked. New air-conditioning units have been installed, and we were told they would be working for summer. Breakfast is nothing special, and you better be early as there are not an abundance of choice.
Reviews.Author: Aroborus

Reviews.Content: Great and charming Hotel I've been in Locanda degli Artisti 2 days ago with a friend of mine...it was marvellous!!! It is a lovely hotel, completely different from all the others in the same street and the staff at the reception was so nice, friendly and really helpful. I asked info about tours inside and outside the city and they offer me different choice and information about museums, restaurants....I will recommend to all I know this paradise!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stay Away! Easily the worst hotel we stayed at in Italy. We kept the window open because it was incredibly hot and we were hoping the room would cool off (end of May). The rooms had no screens which isn't unusual, but the mosquitos were ferocious. There was constant noise from scooters going up and down the narrow street. The beds sagged. The room smelled and wasn't clean. The best feature was the convivial large table at breakfast the next morning which facilitates meeting other guests; the location is excellent. Do yourself a favor and find someplace else. I would never stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Jesse Kumin
